answerText: "The Minister's Black Veil"[10] "The Minister's Black Veil" appears in this collection, which also contains "Dr. Heidegger's Experiment" and "The May-Pole of Merry Mount." Its stories were all previously published in magazines of some sort.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | University of North Carolina, Truman State A, and University of Toronto | 18 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: Elizabeth asks the title character, "What grievous affliction hath befallen you that you should thus darken your eyes forever," and an unsatisfactory answer forces her to leave him forever.  [10] Name this Hawthorne short story in which Reverend Hooper remains unwilling to remove the title piece of clothing, even to his death.
